conclusion: To determine the time at which the two waves meet, we need to analyze the given information and the wave motion.
The wave speed is given as 0.4 m/s, and the amplitude of the waves is 2 m.
The wave period T is given by T = 1/v, where v is the wave speed.
For the left wave, T1 = 1/v1 = 1/0.4 = 2.5 s.
For the right wave, T2 = 1/v2 = 1/0.4 = 2.5 s.
The left wave starts at x = -0.2 m and the right wave starts at x = 1.2 m.
The left wave reaches x = 0.2 m at t = 0.
The right wave reaches x = 0.8 m at t = 0.
